Name: wo_utterance.json â€” Workorder scenario utterances (AssetOpsBench)
Labeled: Yes (many records include deterministic expected outputs in `characteristic_form`)
Time Series: No (this file contains scenario/utterance records referencing work order datasets; it is not raw telemetry)
Dataset Characteristics: A collection of work-order related utterance scenarios used to evaluate agent retrieval, summarization, and filtering logic for maintenance records. Each record contains an id, textual prompt, type (Workorder), optional deterministic flag, and a `characteristic_form` describing expected results (counts, filters by equipment and year, distribution summaries).
Feature Type: Categorical (id, type, deterministic), Text (text, characteristic_form), small structured fields (e.g., expected counts)
Associated Tasks: Work-order retrieval, aggregation (counts by code/month), preventive vs corrective filtering, asset-year filtering, NLP-to-query translation for maintenance systems
Summary: 36 work-order scenario utterances (wo_utterance.json) for AssetOpsBench. Scenarios ask agents to fetch, filter, and summarize work orders for specific equipment and year ranges (e.g., equipment CWC04013 in 2017).
Description: This JSON file (`wo_utterance.json`) contains 36 prompt records used to evaluate agent behavior on maintenance work-order tasks. Entries request retrieval of work orders for specific equipment and time windows, summaries of work-order distribution by code or month, and filtering by preventive vs corrective types. Many entries are deterministic and contain expected counts to validate correct filtering and aggregation.
